title: How to Build a Sod House

steps.title: Build sod houses in September, when the roots of the grass are deepest.
steps.content: Build sod houses in September, when the roots of the grass are deepest. The roots hold the sod bricks together during construction.

steps.title: Find a location that's fairly level in an area that's covered with thick prairie grass, such as buffalo grass.
steps.content: Find a location that's fairly level in an area that's covered with thick prairie grass, such as buffalo grass. Mark the area where you will build the house so you will know where to place the exterior walls. Leave a space for the door.

steps.title: Dig up the sod inside the marked area, rake the dirt until it's smooth and level and tamp it down as much as you can.
steps.content: Dig up the sod inside the marked area, rake the dirt until it's smooth and level and tamp it down as much as you can. This creates the floor of the house.

steps.title: Mow the grass to a height of 4 inches.
steps.content: Mow the grass to a height of 4 inches.

steps.title: Slice the sod into 2-foot (61 cm) strips.
steps.content: Slice the sod into 2-foot (61 cm) strips. Cut down to a depth of 4 inches. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the strips across at 1-foot (30 cm) intervals.
steps.content: Cut the strips across at 1-foot (30 cm) intervals. This creates uniform bricks of sod which you can then remove and stack near where you will build the house. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Lay 1 row of bricks on the ground, grass-side down.
steps.content: Lay 1 row of bricks on the ground, grass-side down. Follow the markers for the exterior walls.

steps.title: Lay the second row of sod bricks on top the first.
steps.content: Lay the second row of sod bricks on top the first. Place the center of the second-row bricks directly over where two first-row bricks meet. You must cut some bricks in half to fit the corners. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add subsequent rows of bricks over the first rows.
steps.content: Add subsequent rows of bricks over the first rows. Stagger the bricks so the ends of the bricks on the row below are directly under the centers of the bricks on top. Every few rows, lay the bricks crosswise to the row underneath to help make the walls more sturdy.

steps.title: Lay sod brick until your walls reach the bottom of where you want your windows.
steps.content: Lay sod brick until your walls reach the bottom of where you want your windows. Place the frames for the windows on the walls and the door frame in the space you left for the door.

steps.title: Continue building the walls around the window and door frames.
steps.content: Continue building the walls around the window and door frames. Leave room between the bricks and the frames and stuff the spaces with grass. If you pack too closely, the sod may settle and cause the frames to shift or the window glass to break. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Construct a roof for your sod house.
steps.content: Construct a roof for your sod house. Several styles of roof were used on sod houses, ranging from flat roofs made from a lattice of tree branches, to traditional gabled roofs made from lumber, tar paper and shingles. A quality roof can protect a sod house for many years with little need for maintenance. [5] X Trustworthy Source Missouri Botanical Garden Oldest botanical garden in the U.S. and center for botanical research and science education Go to source

steps.title: Cover the roof with sod.
steps.content: Cover the roof with sod. Place the grass-side up to protect against erosion.

steps.title: Suspend a muslin sheet to the roof inside the house to form a sort of ceiling that will catch any dirt or water that falls from the roof.
steps.content: Suspend a muslin sheet to the roof inside the house to form a sort of ceiling that will catch any dirt or water that falls from the roof.

steps.title: Fill any spaces remaining in the walls with additional sod or grass.
steps.content: Fill any spaces remaining in the walls with additional sod or grass.

steps.title: Smooth the inside of the walls and whitewash them.
steps.content: Smooth the inside of the walls and whitewash them. You may also choose to cover the outside of the walls with stucco to protect them from the weather.
